transcript: be sent to work, assistance was to be given to the serfs, punish- ments were to be admonitory and not corporal, and hospitals, asylums, and schools were to be established on all the estates. Some of the stew- ards (there were semiliterate foremen among them) listened with alarm, supposing these words to mean that the young count was dis- pleased with their management and embezzle- ment of money, some after their first fright were amused by Pierre's lisp and the new words they had not heard be
